name: october 2025 mystery
notes:
this year's little mystery pattern was extracted from one of my first patterns: [butterfly 40](/patterns/library/butterfly-40-2).

learn more about ashlee's mystery designs at [https://ashleeslint.com/2023/11/07/october-mystery-patterns/][1]


there are **two files included** in this listing:

- interlocking crochet: fully written pattern and chart
- overlay mosaic crochet: fully written pattern and x-marked chart



***important details***

**interlocking crochet**
• chart is 41 x 41
• finished size 10” / 26cm
• 4.5 mm hook (us7)
• worsted weight yarn (200 - 225 yards total)
o main color (mc) (dark lines) – 100 yards plus 25 yards for
optional border
o accent color (ac) (background) – 100 yards
• gauge: 8 (dc, ch) x 8 rows = 4”

**overlay mosaic crochet**
• chart is 37 x 37
• size without fringe or border: 10.5” x 10” / 27cm x 25cm
• 5 mm hook (h-8)
• worsted weight yarn (130 – 230 yards total)
o main color (dark lines) – 50 yards
o contrasting color (background) – 80 yards
o optional envelope border – 100 yards
• gauge: 14 stitches x 15 rows = 4”

____

**techniques**

the locked filet mesh (lfm) interlocking crochet method uses only chain spaces and double crochets to create a mesh; two colors are worked alternately which creates the pattern.

mosaic crochet is single crochet and double crochet stitches. the double crochet stitches cover some of the other color's single crochet stitches to create the design. my patterns instruct you to cut your yarn at the end of each row. the back is striped but often gives a faint impression of the pattern on the front (sort of like illusion knitting).
____

i have youtube tutorials available for both crochet methods! follow this link to get to my youtube channel and find my other social links: [https://ashleeslint.com/link-in-bio][2]
_____

**testers**

thank you to my testers: cyncitycrochet, deahanna hernandez lieb, erin carlson, eva, henriette van wyck, kim b, marie sparks, nancy mckain, sonjia schultz, and teresa.
